fields_of_interest: Agriculture, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Trade, Competition, Consumers, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Enlargement, Environment, Youth, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Food Safety, Climate Action, Communication, Fraud prevention
eu_initiatives:
FiBL is following the negotiation on the mid-term revision of Horizon 2020 and the development of the 9th Framework Program. 
 
Additionally FiBL Europe is following the negotiations on the new Organic Farming Regulation, and the negotiations on the future CAP.
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions

goals__remit: FiBL is an independent, non-profit, research institute with the aim of advancing cutting-edge science in the field of organic agriculture. FiBL’s research team works together with farmers to develop innovative and cost-effective solutions to boost agricultural productivity while never losing sight of environmental, health and socio-economic impacts. Alongside practical research, FiBL gives high priority to transferring knowledge into agricultural practice through advisory work, training and conferences. FiBL has offices in Switzerland, Germany, Austria, France and Brusels (FiBL Europe) and numerous projects and initiatives in Europe, Asia, Latin America and Africa.
relevant_communication:
FiBL Europe is involved in the coordination of many different EU research projects in collaboration with the other FiBL national centers. Among them you can find the next ones: 
 
Diversifood, is an project with the aim to promote, evaluate and enrich the diversity of cultivated plants within diverse agroecosystems so as to increase their performance, resilience and quality through a multi-actor approach.   
http://www.fibl.org/en/projectdatabase/projectitem/project/1156.html 
 
OK arable net, the project aims to improve the exchange of knowledge among farmers, farm advisers and scientists to increase productivity and quality in organic arable cropping all over Europe. 
http://www.fibl.org/en/projectdatabase/projectitem/project/989.html 
 
DiverIMPACTS, The overall goal of DiverIMPACTS is to achieve the full potential of diversification of cropping systems for improved productivity, delivery of ecosystem services and resource-efficient and sustainable value chains.  
http://www.fibl.org/en/projectdatabase/projectitem/project/1276.html 
 
OrganicXseeds.com, is a List of organic seed and propagation material. Already in use in Belgium, Germany, Ireland, Luxembourg, Sweden, Switzerland and the United Kingdom and will be further expanded https://www.organicxseeds.com/international/countryselect 
 
Organic inputs list accepted for organic agriculture. National lists of evaluated products are already produced for Germany, the Netherlands, and Switzerland; European input list is in preparation. 
see www.organicinputs.org
